raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

* In the context of the present invention, an antibody is said to “bind” a define antigen (or epitope) or to “recognize” said antigen (or epitope) if said antibody has an affinity constant K<sub>a </sub>(which is the inverted dissociation constant, i.e. 1/K<sub>d</sub>) higher than 10<sup>5 </sup>M<sup>−1</sup>, preferably higher than 10<sup>6 </sup>M<sup>−1</sup>, more preferably higher than 10<sup>7 </sup>M<sup>−1 </sup>for said antigen (or epitope).
* To avoid occurrence of these interferences, it is for example possible to use sodium deoxycholate as detergent, in a concentration from 0.1% to 0.18%.
